comments: a(n) is the determinant of the 4 X 4 Hankel matrix [a_0, a_1, a_2, a_3 ; a_1, a_2, a_3, a_4 ; a_2, a_3, a_4, a_5 ; a_3, a_4, a_5, a_6] with a_j=A000108(n+j). - _Philippe Deléham_, Apr 12 2007
references: S. J. Cyvin and I. Gutman, Kekulé structures in benzenoid hydrocarbons, Lecture Notes in Chemistry, No. 46, Springer, New York, 1988 (see p. 183).
M. de Sainte-Catherine, Couplages et Pfaffiens en Combinatoire. Physique et Informatique. Ph.D Dissertation, Université Bordeaux I, 1983.
Nicholas M. Katz, A NOTE ON RANDOM MATRIX INTEGRALS, MOMENT IDENTITIES, AND CATALAN NUMBERS, 2015; https://web.math.princeton.edu/~nmk/catalan11.pdf
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..140
maple: with(linalg): ctln:= proc(n) option remember; binomial(2*n,n)/ (n+1) end: a:= n-> det(Matrix(4, (i,j)-> ctln(i+j-2+n))): seq(a(n), n=0..20);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 10 2008
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 10 2008
